node.title: Lack of evidence unravels Lois Tolley murder case
node.description: The case against three men charged with the murder of Upper Hutt woman Lois Tolley in 2016 has unravelled due to lack of evidence.
node.content:
["The case against three men charged with the murder of Upper Hutt woman Lois Tolley in 2016 has unravelled due to lack of evidence.", "", "
Lois Tolley was shot in her Ward Street home in December 2016. Photo: RNZ / Supplied / NZ Police
", "Judge Simon France has withdrawn the charges, leaving the door open for the police to lay fresh charges against them if new evidence emerges.", "Lois Tolley, who was 30, was killed in what investigators described as an execution style killing in December 2016.", "Two of the defendants were alleged to be among four people who entered her home while the third remained outside."]
